title: Do you pay tax on your Growth Bonds when they mature?
body: {"title":"","options":[{"title":"Tax on savings","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/manage-your-savings/tax-on-savings"}],"content":"It all depends on how much interest you earn in total and what rate of tax you pay.<page_separator delay=\"3\"/>The interest you earn on most savings will count towards your taxable income, but this doesn't mean you'll have to pay tax on it.<page_separator delay=\"5\"/>The interest is taxable but will be paid gross (without tax deducted), in the tax year your Bond matures. title: I need to reset my password
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Forgotten my password","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://secure.nsandi.com/thc/projectuk01-common-b2c/pages/passwordResetB2CSelect01.jsf?chainingAction=true&WTRS=ZYCUPR&sec_token=GETJ-UXTN-PO8A-GE10-TEI0-X2OL-VGUE-SB18"}],"content":"

Don't worry if you've forgotten you're password, you can easily reset this online.

 

You'll just need your 11-digit NS&I number to hand. This will start with either 11, 21, 31 or 41 and your surname.

Also, you'll need to have your phone available as you'll receive an automated call. Just click the link below to get started:","isCTA":true}

title: How many trusted devices can I add online?
body: {"title":"","options":[{"title":"Log in","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/login"}],"content":"You can add up to 15 different browsers and up to 3 different apps online. Don't worry if you reach the maximum browser limit, we'll simply remove the oldest unused trusted one from your profile.<page_separator/>You can manage your trusted devices by logging into your account online at nsandi.com, go to 'Your profile' and click on 'Your details' and scroll down to 'Your trusted devices'","isCTA":true}

title: I need a new temporary password
body: {"title":"","options":[{"title":"How do I reset my password?","kind":"articleTitle","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"1600788592|I need to reset my password"}],"content":"I can help you with this. If you've recently set up your online account for the first time you'll need to call us so that we can send you a new one. Our number is 08085 007 007,  we're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.But, if we already have your up-to-date telephone number, you can reset your password online. You can find more about how to do this below:","isCTA":true}

title: It won't let me take money out of my account
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":" Logging in","content":"To log into your account online, you'll need to use your 11-digit NS&I number that starts with 11, 21, 31 or 41, along with your surname and full password. You can log in online by clicking the button below: 

You can get a reminder of your NS&I number or reset your password below.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"NS&I number reminder","content":"https://secure3.nsandi.com/thc/projectuk01-common-b2c/pages/retrieveUciB2CSelect01.jsf?chainingAction=true&WTRS=ZYCR0A&CW_TOKEN=887I-TPNY-GRL1-YEZ1-AAQX-GIRL-CCGH-ZGX3","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]},{"title":"Reset your password","content":"https://secure3.nsandi.com/thc/projectuk01-common-b2c/pages/passwordResetB2CSelect01.jsf?chainingAction=true&WTRS=ZYCUPR&CW_TOKEN=T83M-3PDY-F5GD-RT1W-Y4JE-E0X1-3BFV-MX4I","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"Making a withdrawal","content":"Which product are you looking to withdraw from?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Premium Bonds","content":"If the payment is showing in your available balance, you can withdraw money straight to your bank account by selecting 'Cash in' online. If you are receiving any messages that may be preventing you from withdrawing money, or the 'Cash in' button isn't showing,  please call us on 08085 007 007 so that we can look into this for you. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Income Bonds","content":"If the money is showing in your available balance, you can withdraw money by selecting 'Take money out' on your Income Bond page online.  If you are receiving any messages that may be preventing you from doing this, you can call us on 08085 007 007 so that we can look into this for you. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Direct Saver","content":"If your money is showing in your available balance, you can complete your withdrawal online by selecting 'Take money out' on your Direct Saver page. If you are receiving any messages that may be preventing you from completing your withdrawal,  please call us on 08085 007 007 so that we can look into this for you. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Children's Bonds","content":"Have these Bonds matured? ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Yes","content":"Since our Children's Bonds are no longer on sale, the account would’ve been transferred to our Residual Account. This is where all of our off-sale products go to until the money has been claimed. You can withdraw your money by completing our online form below.

It usually takes us up to 8 working days for us to make your payment.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Cash in Children’s Bonds","content":"https://forms.nsandi.com/gateway/online-forms/index#/form/withdraw-children-bonds","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"No","content":"Please call us on 08085 007 007 so that we can look into this for you. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}]},{"title":"Direct ISA","content":"If your money is showing in your available balance, you can complete your withdrawal online by selecting 'Take money out' on your Direct ISA page. If you are receiving any messages that may be preventing you from doing this,  please call us on 08085 007 007 so that we can look into this for you.We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Junior ISA","content":"For this product, it won't be possible to withdraw money until you have turned 18.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Index-linked Savings Certificates","content":"Did you last renew your certificate before or after 22 June 2023?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Before","content":"If your Certificate is about to mature and you want to give us your instructions, you can do this by selecting 'Maturity options' online. If you are withdrawing money before your Certificate has matured, please select 'Cash in'. If you are withdrawing money early, you will lose your Index-linking for the current year, and we’ll deduct a penalty equal to 90 days' interest on the amount you cash in.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"After","content":"You can cancel your Certificate within 30 days of receiving your investment record. We'll then refund the full value of your Certificate with any interest and index-linking due. After the 30 days have passed, you will only be able to cash in your Certificate when it matures. ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}]},{"title":"Fixed Interest Savings Certificates","content":"Did you last renew your Certificate before or after 22 June 2023?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Before","content":"If your Certificate is about to mature and you want to give us your instructions, you can do this by selecting 'Maturity options' online. If you are withdrawing money before your Certificate has matured, please select 'Cash in'. If you are withdrawing money early, we’ll deduct a penalty equal to 90 days' interest on the amount you cash in","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"After","content":"You can cancel your Certificate within 30 days of receiving your investment record. We'll then refund the full value of your Certificate with any interest due. After the 30 days have passed, you will only be able to cash in your Certificate when it matures. ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}]},{"title":"Guaranteed Growth Bonds","content":"Did your Bond last renew before or after 1 May 2019?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Before","content":"If your Bond is maturing shortly, you can provide your options by selecting 'Maturity options' once you have selected your product online. If you are withdrawing your money before your Bond has matured, please select 'Cash in'. You will pay a penalty that is equivalent of 90 days' interest on the amount you cash in.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"After","content":"You can cancel your Bond within 30 days of you receiving your investment record. We'll then refund the full value of your Bond with any interest due.

After the 30 days have passed, you will only be able to cash in your Bond at maturity as it's a fixed-term Bond.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}]},{"title":"Guaranteed Income Bonds","content":"Did your Bond last renew before or after 1 May 2019?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Before","content":"If your Bond is maturing shortly, you can provide your options by selecting 'Maturity options' once you have selected your product online. If you are withdrawing your money before your Bond has matured, please select 'Cash in'. title: I’m not getting the passcode to my phone
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Add a new phone number","kind":"articleTitle","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"1877158162|Add a new phone number"},{"title":"My phone number is out-of-date","kind":"articleTitle","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"1877158462|My phone number is out of date"}],"content":"

Don't worry, there is a slight delay when you request your passcode. If you're still not receiving your one-time passcode to your phone, you may need to update your phone details with us. Firstly, check the phone number provided before requesting the code.

  • If your phone number is a mobile you'll receive a text message (If you’re outside the UK, you’ll receive an automated phone call to your mobile number)
  • If your phone number is a landline you'll receive an automated call.
  • You can find more information on how to update your phone number below:
","isCTA":true}

title: Can you explain the difference between your Bonds?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Premium Bonds","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/products/premium-bonds"},{"title":"Income Bonds","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/products/income-bonds"},{"title":"All our ways to save","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/products"}],"content":"

Here are some key facts about Premium Bonds and Income Bonds. You can find out more about our Bonds or ways to save with NS&I by clicking on the buttons below:

Premium Bonds are a fun way to save, with the chance to win tax-free prizes each month.

 

They are great for you if:

  • You fancy winning tax-free prizes, up to £1 million
  • You have £25 or more to save
  • You want to make the most of tax-free saving
  • You want to buy a savings gift for children under 16. 

Premium Bonds may not be for you if:

  • You want a regular income
  • You're looking for guaranteed returns
  • You're concerned about inflation
  • You want to save jointly with someone else

Income Bonds are an easy access savings account that pays your interest monthly, direct to your bank.

 

They are great for you if:

  • You want your interest paid out every month
  • You want to add to your savings pot as you go
  • You need easy access to your money

Income Bonds may not be for you if:

  • You've got less than £500 to invest
  • You want a fixed rate of interest
","isCTA":true}
phrasings/0: {"text":"Can you explain the difference between your Bonds?","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

They are great for you if:

  • You fancy winning tax-free prizes, up to £1 million
  • You have £25 or more to save
  • You want to make the most of tax-free saving
  • You want to buy a savings gift for children under 16. 

Premium Bonds may not be for you if:

  • You want a regular income
  • You're looking for guaranteed returns
  • You're concerned about inflation
  • You want to save jointly with someone else

Income Bonds are an easy access savings account that pays your interest monthly, direct to your bank.

 

They are great for you if:

  • You want your interest paid out every month
  • You want to add to your savings pot as you go
  • You need easy access to your money

Income Bonds may not be for you if:

  • You've got less than £500 to invest
  • You want a fixed rate of interest

body: {"title":"","options":[{"title":"To my bank account","content":"We’ll let you know the good news by email or text message. You’ll then normally receive your prize money in your bank account by the 7th working day of the month.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Reinvested","content":"We'll usually reinvest your prize on the 2nd working day of the month - these Bonds will be eligible to win prizes in the next draw.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Warrant (like a cheque)","content":"Please allow until the first week of the following month in which your prize was won to receive your warrant(s). We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}],"content":"Congratulations on your win! title: What’s the maximum amount I can pay into an account?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Premium Bonds ","content":"The maximum amount you can pay into Premium Bonds is £50,000.
You can invest in your Premium Bonds account as and when you'd want to. Each deposit must be at least £25 and in whole pounds.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Income Bonds","content":"The maximum amount you can pay into Income Bonds is £1 Million per person.
You can invest into your Income Bonds account as and when you'd want to. Each deposit must be at least £500.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Direct Saver","content":"The maximum amount you can pay into a Direct Saver is £2 Million per person.
You can invest into your Direct Saver account as and when you'd want to. Each deposit must be at least £1.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Direct ISA","content":"The maximum amount you can pay into a Direct ISA in the 2021/22 tax year is £20,000.
You can invest into your Direct ISA account as and when you'd want to. Each deposit must be at least £1.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Junior ISA","content":"The maximum amount you can pay into a Junior ISA in the 2021/22 tax year is £9,000.
You can invest into a Junior ISA account as and when you'd want to. title: How do I change my details?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"My name / date of birth","content":"To change your name or date of birth we’ll need to verify your signature, so you can either download and post us a form below or simply write to us at NS&I, Sunderland SR43 2SB.
","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Download form","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/files/asset/pdf/change-of-details.pdf","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]},{"title":"Write to us","content":"Be sure to include your previous name (and previous signature), as well as your new name (and new signature), your holder's or account number, your new and old address. Then send your letter to NS&I, Sunderland SR43 2SB.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}]},{"title":"My address","content":"2079009472","type":"persist","kind":"articleTitle","options":[]},{"title":"Telephone number","content":"Great, so the best way to do this is to go online. Have you tried this already?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Yes","content":"OK, so you'll just need to call us on 08085 007 007 and we'll update this for you. We're available from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"No","content":"We'll need to complete a security call to update your phone number, is your old number still available to receive this?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Yes","content":"To update your telephone number, once logged in:

•    Go to 'Your profile' and click on 'Your details'.
•    Scroll down to 'Your phone numbers’ and click 'Change'
•    Confirm your phone number so that we can complete a security call to update this for you.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"No","content":"If your current mobile phone or landline number is out-of-date or incorrect then we won't be able to make a security call to you. But don't worry, you'll just need to call us on 08085 007 007 and we'll update this for you. We're available from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}]}]},{"title":"Email address","content":"To update your email address, once logged in:
•	Go to 'Your profile' and click on 'Your details'. 
•	Scroll down to 'Your email address’ and click 'Change'
•	Confirm your new email address and click 'Continue'","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}],"contents":["I can help you with that. Which details do you need to update?"]}

title: Why do I have to update my details when I have just registered?
body: {"title":"","options":[{"title":"Bank details","content":"It seems that we don't have your bank details on record; we'll need these details so we can make payments to you. \n\nSo we can update your account, you'll just need to enter your bank details in the box provided, and select 'Continue'. title: How do I check my prizes?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Online prize checker","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/prize-checker"},{"title":"Prize checking FAQs","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/manage-your-savings/premium-bonds-prizes#info-check-prizes"}],"content":"

You can use your holder's number on the prize checker on our website and in our prize checker app. Your holder's number has either 10 or 9 digits, or 8 digits followed by a letter. You can find your holder’s number on your Bond record or by logging into your account. 

If you are registered for our online and phone service, you can also check for prizes with your NS&I number using the prize checker mobile app or on Amazon Alexa. 

For more information about checking prizes, click on the link below.  

 

Good luck in the next draw!

title: How can I contact you?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Facebook","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.facebook.com/nsandi"},{"title":"Twitter","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://twitter.com/nsandihelp"},{"title":"Other ways to contact us","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/contact-us"}],"content":"

If you need to chat to someone, our agents are available from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.

\nOr, if one of our agents isn't available right now you can message us on Twitter or Facebook at any time. Our social media team is available to respond between the hours above.","isCTA":true}

title: I have found an old Premium Bond
body: {"title":"","options":[{"title":"Myself","content":"Are the details we hold for you up to date, such as your name and address? ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Yes","content":"1609257152","type":"persist","kind":"articleTitle","options":[]},{"title":"No","content":"1609270292","type":"persist","kind":"articleTitle","options":[]}]},{"title":"A deceased holder","content":"Our dedicated team can help you with this, all you need to do is get the executor, legal representative or next of kin to fill out an online form which can be found in the link below. Don’t worry if you don’t have all of the account details, just give us as much information as you can and we’ll write back to you.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Online form","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/manage-money-for-others/customers-who-have-died","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"Someone else","content":"Are they 16 or over?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Yes","content":"So that we can provide them with more information of their account, please have the account holder write to us at NS&I, Sunderland SR43 2SB. Click the link below for what they need to include in the letter.  ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Write to us","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/contact-us#write-to-us","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"No","content":"So that we can provide them with more information of the account, please have the nominated person write to us at NS&I, Sunderland SR43 2SB. Click the link below for what they need to include in the letter.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Write to us","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/contact-us#write-to-us","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]}]},{"title":"I don't know","content":"So that we can look to provide more information about the account, please write to us at NS&I, Sunderland SR43 2SB. Click the link below for what you need to include in your letter. We’ll write back to you to confirm whether they belong to you or not. If they do not, we will hold the Bonds until the account holder contacts us as we cannot confirm their identity for GDPR purposes. title: What is probate?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"What to do if an NS&I customer has died","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/manage-money-for-others/customers-who-have-died"}],"content":"

Probate is the legal right to deal with someone's estate when they die. We will let you know if we need a Grant of Probate (also known as a Grant of Representation or Grant of Letters of Administration) once we receive your completed bereavement form.

\nYou can find more information on managing someone's account when they die by clicking the link below:","isCTA":true}

title: How do I register a Power of Attorney?
body: {"title":"","options":[{"title":"Before","content":"To register a Power of Attorney, please post us the original document, or a certified copy, to NS&I, Sunderland SR43 2SB. We recommend that you use a secure service. A Court of Protection Order should be sealed or bear the blue office copy stamp. Do you need more information about how to certify your Authority?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Yes","content":"1603666282","type":"persist","kind":"articleTitle","options":[]},{"title":"No","content":"If you need any further information about how to register, or how to manage someone’s savings, we have advice depending on your type of Authority:","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Managing savings on behalf of someone else","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/manage-money-for-others/manage-saving-for-adult","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]}]},{"title":"After","content":"Following the introduction of a service provided by the Office of the Public Guardian, we're trialing a new service whereby you may not need to send the full documentation to us. title: What can I send as proof of my identity?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Documents that prove your identity and address","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/join-nsandi/evidence-of-identity"}],"content":"

If we've asked you to provide your identity and address you'll need to send us:

 

  • One document giving proof of your identity
  • One document giving proof of your address

 

to NS&I Sunderland, SR43 2SB. You can find more information on what documents we need by clicking the link below.

You cannot use the same document for proof of both your identity and address (such as your driving licence).

If you live outside the UK (Rest of the World), you'll need to send us both of the following:

 

  • A certified copy of your passport or official identity card
  • An original or certified copy of a bank statement (no more than three months old) showing your name and address.
For valuable documents like passports and driving licences, we recommend you send us certified copies instead of the originals, but if you choose to send original documents please use a secure postal service.","isCTA":true}
phrasings/0: {"text":"What can I send as proof of my identity?","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

title: How do I certify my documents?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Evidence of identity and address","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/join-nsandi/evidence-of-identity"}],"content":"

Your documents need to be certified by one of the following people:

  • Qualified individual currently practising in the legal, financial, or teaching profession
  • Doctor or dentist
  • Minister of a recognised religion
  • Civil servant
  • Prison, police or customs officer

The person you choose must not be related to you by birth or marriage. They also must not be in a personal relationship with you or live at the same address.

Ask your chosen certifier to:

  • Write the following on the copied document in English: “I certify that this is a true copy of the original [type of document] belonging to [your/your child’s name].”
  • Print their full name, then sign and date the document
  • Write their occupation or the capacity in which they are providing the certification (e.g. lawyer, doctor, teacher)
  • Provide their work address and daytime telephone number
  • Affix any relevant official stamp where available
You can find out more information about providing your evidence of identity here:","isCTA":true}
phrasings/0: {"text":"I want to ask about certifying documents","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

title: How do I register if my details have changed?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Online registration form","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/files/asset/pdf/online-and-phone-service-registration-form.pdf"}],"content":"

If you want to register to manage your savings online or by phone using an account with old details, you’ll just need to send a registration form to NS&I, Sunderland SR43 2SB - you can print the form by clicking the button below:

\nWe’ll then send you your NS&I number and a temporary password by post, to the address that you’ve provided. These will arrive separately for security. The form will include all instructions that you'll need to activate your password.","isCTA":true}

phrasings/0: {"text":"I need to fill out a form to register online, where do I find the form?","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

title: I am dealing with the administration of an estate
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Bereavement form","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/manage-money-for-others/customers-who-have-died"}],"content":"

Sorry to hear of your sad loss. Our dedicated team can help you with this, all you need to do for now is get the executor, legal representative or next of kin to fill out an online form which can be found below.

\nDon’t worry if you don’t have many/any details of the account, just give us as much information as you can and we’ll write back to you.","isCTA":true}
phrasings/0: {"text":"I am dealing with the administration of an estate","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

title: Where can I find your forms?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Forms","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/downloads-and-forms"}],"content":"

If you're not registered, you may be able to fill in an online form or download a postal form to manage your savings and personal details by clicking on the button below. 

\nIf the form you need can't be completed online or you do not have access to a printer, please call us on 08085 007 007 so we can post it to you. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","isCTA":true}

body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Forms","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/downloads-and-forms"}],"content":"

If you're not registered, you may be able to fill in an online form or download a postal form to manage your savings and personal details by clicking on the button below. 

\nIf the form you need can't be completed online or you do not have access to a printer, please call us on 08085 007 007 so we can post it to you. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","isCTA":true}
phrasings/0: {"text":"Where can I get your online forms?","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

title: I want to log a complaint
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Complaints brochure","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/files/asset/pdf/complaints-brochure-print-friendly.pdf"}],"content":"

Our dedicated team will aim to resolve your complaint promptly.

To make a complaint, please email us at customerenquiries@nsandi.com

Please remember to include your postal address so we can reply to you.

Our brochure explains how we deal with complaints. 

","isCTA":true}

title: I've received a temporary password and I'm trying to register it
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Creating a password","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/join-nsandi/create-password"},{"title":"NS&I number retrieval","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://secure3.nsandi.com/thc/projectuk01-common-b2c/pages/retrieveUciB2CSelect01.jsf?chainingAction=true&WTRS=ZYCR0A&CW_TOKEN=I7NY-HK0F-XL5F-ECPD-0M5O-C8KH-Q90Q-DPDO"}],"content":"

You can log in to change your temporary password. You'll need your 11-digit NS&I number to hand. This will start with either 11, 21, 31 or 41. If you've recently registered for the online and phone service, we'll send you your NS&I number separately in the post or by email.

\n

If you need a reminder of your NS&I number, just click on the NS&I number retrieval link below. Please check your spam folder if you don’t receive it after a few minutes.

\nOnce you have your NS&I number and your temporary password, we have some simple rules for creating new passwords that you can view by clicking on the Creating a password link below.","isCTA":true}
phrasings/0: {"text":"I've received a temporary password and I'm trying to register it","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

title: How do I find my holder's number?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Log in","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://nsandi.com/login"},{"title":"How do I get a Premium Bond record?","kind":"articleTitle","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"1627046902|Can you send me a statement?"}],"content":"

You can find your holder's number on your Premium Bond record or by logging into your account online. It has either 10 or 9 digits, or 8 digits followed by a letter. You can find out how to get a Premium Bond record below.

\nOnce you've logged in online you can view your holder's number by scrolling down to 'Your accounts' and under 'Premium Bonds' you'll find it there.","isCTA":true}
phrasings/0: {"text":"How do I find my holder's number?","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

title: I would like to register online
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Yes","content":"Great! And do you live in the UK?
","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Yes","content":"You can register to manage your savings online by clicking the button below.

Once you’re all set up, you can also use these details to manage your savings over the phone, should you ever need to call us. ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Register online","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/online-registration","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"No","content":"So, if you want to register to manage your savings online overseas, you’ll just need to send a registration form to us at NS&I, Sunderland SR43 2SB - you can print the form by clicking the button below: 

We’ll then send you your NS&I number and (separately) a temporary password by post, to the address that you’ve provided. 

The form will include all instructions that you'll need to activate your password. 

Once you’re all set up, you can also use these details to manage your savings over the phone, should you ever need to call us. ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Online registration form","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/files/asset/pdf/online-and-phone-service-registration-form.pdf","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]}]},{"title":"No","content":"Not a problem, if you want to register to manage your savings online using an account with old details, you’ll just need to send a registration form to us at NS&I, Sunderland SR43 2SB - you can print the form by clicking the button below: 

We’ll then send you your NS&I number and (separately) a temporary password by post, to the address that you’ve provided. 

The form will include all instructions that you'll need to activate your password. 

Once you’re all set up, you can also use these details to manage your savings over the phone, should you ever need to call us. ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Online registration form ","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/files/asset/pdf/online-and-phone-service-registration-form.pdf","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]}],"content":"I can help you with that. Firstly is your current name and address the same as on your account?"}
phrasings/0: {"text":"I would like to register online","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Online registration form","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/files/asset/pdf/online-and-phone-service-registration-form.pdf"}],"content":"

To register to manage your savings online or by phone, all details on your account must be correct and up to date. We'll also need to verify your identity.

If any information is missing or incorrect, you’ll be provided with the option to register by post instead. You can print a copy of the form below.

 

Please return this to us at NS&I, Sunderland SR43 2SB.

title: I want to take ownership of my account
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Own account","content":"Great! You can register to manage your savings online using the button below.

Once you’re all set up, you can also use these details to manage your savings over the phone, should you ever need to call us. ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Register now","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/online-registration","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"Bought for me as a child","content":"If someone set up a savings account for you when you were a child, you’ll now be able to manage it yourself.

You’ll need to complete a registration form and send it to us first. This is because we need someone to witness your signature as proof of identity.

Once we have this, you’ll be able to manage your accounts online (except from Investment Account, which can only be managed by post).

Please ask a witness (anyone over 18, but not a family member) to write the following in a covering letter, which they’ll need to sign and date: "I certify that (your name) signed the enclosed form in my presence and that I am not a member of the same family".

We'll also need your witness to print their name, address and occupation in the same letter. Please send the letter to us with the completed form.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Download a registration form","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/files/asset/pdf/online-and-phone-service-registration-form.pdf","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]}],"content":"I can help you with that. Firstly, are you trying to take ownership of an account you opened or one that was opened for you as a child?"}
phrasings/0: {"text":"I want to take ownership of my account","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

title: Can I hold Premium Bonds outside the UK?
body: {"title":"","options":[{"title":"Living outside the UK","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/join-nsandi/using-nsandi-outside-uk"}],"content":"If you live outside the UK, you'll need to check if local regulations let you hold Premium Bonds. In the US, there are strict gambling and lottery laws which means it might not be possible or practical to hold them there.<page_separator delay=\"5\"/>If you're allowed to hold them, you'll need to apply by post first. Once your holding has been set up, you can register for our online and phone service.<page_separator delay=\"5\"/>Bonds can only be purchased online or by phone using a personal debit card issued by a UK bank or building society. Any prizes you win will be paid in Sterling. You can find out more information on this by clicking the link below:","isCTA":true}

body: {"title":"","options":[{"title":"Living outside the UK","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/join-nsandi/using-nsandi-outside-uk"}],"content":"If you live outside the UK, you'll need to check if local regulations let you hold Premium Bonds. In the US, there are strict gambling and lottery laws which means it might not be possible or practical to hold them there.<page_separator delay=\"5\"/>If you're allowed to hold them, you'll need to apply by post first. Once your holding has been set up, you can register for our online and phone service.<page_separator delay=\"5\"/>Bonds can only be purchased online or by phone using a personal debit card issued by a UK bank or building society. Any prizes you win will be paid in Sterling. You can find out more information on this by clicking the link below:","isCTA":true}

title: I am having trouble paying in money via debit card
body: {"title":"","options":[{"title":"Yes","content":"Please amend your address details before attempting your transaction again. Just log in online, go to 'Your details' and select 'Your profile’.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Log in","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/login","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"No","content":"As we’re not a bank, we can’t receive or reject payments – they have to go through our clearing bank first. The two institutions in control of this are your bank, who holds the funds, and your debit card provider (e.g. VISA). If your bank has confirmed there is no error on their end, please contact your card provider to assist you with this.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}],"contents":["When you pay by debit card, your name and address on your card needs to match your address with us. If it doesn’t, the payment won’t be successful. Does this explain why your debit card might be declined?"]}

title: I want to buy some more Premium Bonds
body: {"title":"","options":[{"title":"My own","content":"You can buy more Premium Bonds by clicking the button below and then selecting 'Ways to top up':","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Top up","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/manage-your-savings/top-up-savings","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"Someone else","content":"Is the Bond holder under 16?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Yes","content":"Are you the child’s parent or guardian?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Yes","content":"You can top up your child’s Premium Bonds by clicking the button below and then selecting 'For parents or guardians':","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Top up child savings","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/manage-money-for-others/top-up-child-savings","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"No","content":"You can top up the child’s Premium Bonds by clicking the button below and then selecting 'For other adults':","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Top up child savings","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/manage-money-for-others/top-up-child-savings","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]}]},{"title":"No","content":"Sorry, you can only buy Premium Bonds for someone else if they’re under 16. title: Income Bonds money is not showing in my account
body: {"title":"","options":[{"title":"Bank transfer","content":"If you bought Income Bonds between the 20th of a month and the 5th of the following month, your deposit won’t show in your balance until the next banking day after the 5th. This is because we use this period to start calculating and preparing all the monthly interest payments.\nWhen you make a bank transfer, the money takes 2 to 3 banking days to reach your account.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Debit card","content":"If you bought Income Bonds between the 20th of a month and the 5th of the following month, your deposit won’t show in your balance until the next banking day after the 5th. This is because we use this period to start calculating and preparing all the monthly interest payments.\nYou will, however, be able to see your deposit in the ‘Pending transactions’ section of your online account.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}],"content":"I can help you with this. How did you make your Income Bonds payment?"}

title: I would like to close my account
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Premium Bonds","content":"Are you registered to manage your accounts online or by phone?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Yes","content":"You can close your account or cash in all of your investments online by logging into your account - you’ll just need your 11-digit NS&I number and password to hand. Once logged in;                             
• On your account dashboard, go to the account you want to close and choose 'Cash in' or 'Take money out'.
• Enter the full balance in the amount box and then choose 'Cash in' or 'Take money out'.
• On the next page, confirm you want to close the account. ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Log in","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/login","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"No","content":"You can use an online form to close and cash in all of your investments for your account or your child's account. Please note: you must be the person responsible for the child’s Premium Bonds in order to withdraw them and close the account.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Close my account","content":"https://forms.nsandi.com/gateway/online-forms/index#/form/withdraw-premium-bonds-myself","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]},{"title":"Close my child's account","content":"https://forms.nsandi.com/gateway/online-forms/index#/form/withdraw-premium-bonds-child","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]}]},{"title":"Junior ISA","content":"Withdrawals cannot be made from the Junior ISA account until the child is 18, so you would not be able to close the investment. 

On the child’s 18th birthday, we’ll automatically transfer the money to an adult cash ISA from NS&I. The child will then be able to withdraw money. We’ll contact the person who looks after the account about a month before the transfer happens.

If you would prefer to transfer the Junior ISA balance to another provider, there's no need to contact us. Please inform the new provider to contact us as they will request your money from us directly.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Income Bonds","content":"Are you registered to manage your accounts online or by phone?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Yes","content":"You can close your account or cash in all of your investments online by logging into your account - you’ll just need your 11-digit NS&I number and password to hand. Once logged in;                             
• On your account dashboard, go to the account you want to close and choose 'Cash in' or 'Take money out'.
• Enter the full balance in the amount box and then choose 'Cash in' or 'Take money out'.
• On the next page, confirm you want to close the account. ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Log in","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/login","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"No","content":"You can use an online form to close and cash in all of your investments for your account here:","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Close my account","content":"https://forms.nsandi.com/gateway/online-forms/index#/form/withdraw-income-bonds","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]}]},{"title":"Direct ISA","content":"You can close your account or cash in all of your investments online by logging into your account - you’ll just need your 11-digit NS&I number and password to hand. Once logged in;                             
• On your account dashboard, go to the account you want to close and choose 'Cash in' or 'Take money out'.
• Enter the full balance in the amount box and then choose 'Cash in' or 'Take money out'.
• On the next page, confirm you want to close the account. ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Log in","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/login","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"Direct Saver","content":"You can close your account or cash in all of your investments online by logging into your account - you’ll just need your 11-digit NS&I number and password to hand. Once logged in;                             
• On your account dashboard, go to the account you want to close and choose 'Cash in' or 'Take money out'.
• Enter the full balance in the amount box and then choose 'Cash in' or 'Take money out'.
• On the next page, confirm you want to close the account. ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Log in","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/login","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"Investment Account","content":"You can use an online form to close and cash in all of your investments for your account here:","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Close my account","content":"https://forms.nsandi.com/gateway/online-forms/index#/form/withdraw-investment-account","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"Other product not listed","content":"Sometimes, when we close a product or your fixed-term savings mature, we move your money to our Residual Account (an account that we hold your money in temporarily). You can use the online form found in the link below to withdraw your savings from our Residual Account.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Closing your account","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/leaving-nsandi/closing-account","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]}],"content":"I can help you with that. Which type of account are you looking to close?"}

body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Payment timeline calculator","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/manage-your-savings/make-withdrawal-from-savings"}],"content":"

The time it takes to receive a withdrawal depends on which NS&I account you have, how much you want to take out and how you give us your withdrawal instruction. The quickest way to get your money is to tell us by logging into your online account.

\nYou can find out when to expect your payment by clicking on the link below and scrolling down to the Payment Timeline Calculator in the green box. ","isCTA":true}

title: I am still waiting to receive my withdrawal
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Withdrawal","content":"The time it takes to receive a withdrawal depends on which NS&I account you have, how much you want to take out and how you give us your withdrawal instruction. You can find out when to expect your payment below.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Use our payment timeline calculator","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/manage-your-savings/make-withdrawal-from-savings","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"Refund","content":"What type of refund does your query relate to?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Cancelled sale","content":"If your sale is cancelled, the funds would take 3-5 working days to return to your account. ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Declined payment","content":"If a payment is automatically declined before processing we have no control over the timescale as we wouldn't have received the funds. This could take up to 10 working days depending on your bank.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Electronic payment","content":"Electronic payments that are rejected will be sent back to the bank account they were taken from the next working day from when the transfer was attempted. ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}]},{"title":"Prize","content":"How are you set up to receive your prizes? ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Through the post","content":"With millions of prizes to send every month, it can take us a while to get around to everyone.

If you still haven’t received your winnings by the end of the month, please call us on 08085 007 007 to let us know so that we can deal with this. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Automatic reinvestment","content":"If you have your prizes automatically reinvested and you can’t see the money after the third working day of the month, please call us on 08085 007 007 for us to look into this. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Straight into your nominated account","content":"If you have your prizes paid straight to your nominated account and you can’t see the money after the seventh working day of the month, please call us on 08085 007 007 to make sure we’ve got the right details for you. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}]},{"title":"Transfer in","content":"How did you make this payment? ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Debit card deposit","content":"Any deposits made after 20:00 may not show on your online account until 07:00 the following day. This is because the transaction was completed outside of our banking hours. You’ll receive a confirmation email once this deposit has been added to your account.

If the funds are not showing in your holding after this time, please call us on 08085 007 007 so that we can help. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Bank transfer/standing order","content":"Bank transfers and standing orders usually take 2 to 3 working days to show in your account.

If the funds aren't showing in your holding after this time, please call us on 08085 007 007 so that we can chase this payment up. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.
","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Postal application","content":"Once we receive your form, you’d usually expect to receive the money-back within eight working days. 

If we've received your form prior to this and you’ve not heard from us please call us on 08085 007 007 so that we can help with this. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}]}],"content":"I need some more information so that we can point you in the right direction. What does your question relate to?"}

We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Bank transfer/standing order","content":"Bank transfers and standing orders usually take 2 to 3 working days to show in your account.

If the funds aren't showing in your holding after this time, please call us on 08085 007 007 so that we can chase this payment up. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.
","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Postal application","content":"Once we receive your form, you’d usually expect to receive the money-back within eight working days. 

If we've received your form prior to this and you’ve not heard from us please call us on 08085 007 007 so that we can help with this. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}]}],"content":"I need some more information so that we can point you in the right direction. What does your question relate to?"}

title: I am still waiting to receive my withdrawal
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Withdrawal","content":"The time it takes to receive a withdrawal depends on which NS&I account you have, how much you want to take out and how you give us your withdrawal instruction. You can find out when to expect your payment below.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Use our payment timeline calculator","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/manage-your-savings/make-withdrawal-from-savings","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"Refund","content":"What type of refund does your query relate to?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Cancelled sale","content":"If your sale is cancelled, the funds would take 3-5 working days to return to your account. ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Declined payment","content":"If a payment is automatically declined before processing we have no control over the timescale as we wouldn't have received the funds. This could take up to 10 working days depending on your bank.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Electronic payment","content":"Electronic payments that are rejected will be sent back to the bank account they were taken from the next working day from when the transfer was attempted. ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}]},{"title":"Prize","content":"How are you set up to receive your prizes? ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Through the post","content":"With millions of prizes to send every month, it can take us a while to get around to everyone.

If you still haven’t received your winnings by the end of the month, please call us on 08085 007 007 to let us know so that we can deal with this. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Automatic reinvestment","content":"If you have your prizes automatically reinvested and you can’t see the money after the third working day of the month, please call us on 08085 007 007 for us to look into this. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Straight into your nominated account","content":"If you have your prizes paid straight to your nominated account and you can’t see the money after the seventh working day of the month, please call us on 08085 007 007 to make sure we’ve got the right details for you. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}]},{"title":"Transfer in","content":"How did you make this payment? ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Debit card deposit","content":"Any deposits made after 20:00 may not show on your online account until 07:00 the following day. This is because the transaction was completed outside of our banking hours. You’ll receive a confirmation email once this deposit has been added to your account.

If the funds are not showing in your holding after this time, please call us on 08085 007 007 so that we can help. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Bank transfer/standing order","content":"Bank transfers and standing orders usually take 2 to 3 working days to show in your account.

If the funds aren't showing in your holding after this time, please call us on 08085 007 007 so that we can chase this payment up. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.
","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Postal application","content":"Once we receive your form, you’d usually expect to receive the money-back within eight working days. 

If we've received your form prior to this and you’ve not heard from us please call us on 08085 007 007 so that we can help with this. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}]}],"content":"I need some more information so that we can point you in the right direction. What does your question relate to?"}

title: How do I know my payment has been received?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Bank transfer payment","content":"When you make a bank transfer, the money takes 2 to 3 banking days to reach your account. This is because NS&I is not a bank, so we can’t receive payments directly into individual NS&I accounts – they have to go through our clearing bank first.

Please remember: if you're investing with us by bank transfer, all the details you enter when making your payment (including our details as the payee) must be correct. Otherwise, your payment won't be successful. ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Debit card payment","content":"If you’re not sure your payment has been taken by debit card there’s no need to try again, as your payment might be taken twice. Instead, call us on the next working day and we’ll be able to confirm your payment has been received.

If you've disabled your third-party cookies, you might not be able to complete your transactions.

If you’re struggling to complete your payment online, please check your cookies settings. To find out how to change your cookie settings, go to: www.aboutcookies.org","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Pending Income Bonds balance","content":"If you opened your account by debit card between the 20th of a month and the 5th of the following month, your deposit won’t show in your balance until the next banking day after the 5th. 

This is because we use this period to start calculating and preparing all the monthly interest payments. You will, however, be able to see your deposit in the ‘Pending transactions’ section of your online account.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Balance hasn't updated","content":"If your balance hasn’t updated at all we may ask for evidence of your identity and address before we update your account balance, especially if you’re investing for the first time.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}],"content":"When you make a payment, you may not see your new savings balance straight away. 

Don’t worry if this happens – there are sometimes a few things we need to do behind the scenes before we update your balance. What is your issue regarding?"}

This is because NS&I is not a bank, so we can’t receive payments directly into individual NS&I accounts – they have to go through our clearing bank first.

{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Yes","content":"Which product are you looking to withdraw from?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Premium Bonds","content":"If your funds are showing in your available balance, please call us on 08085 007 007 so that we can look into this error for you. We're open from 7am until 10pm seven days a week.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Income Bonds","content":"If your funds are showing in your available balance, please call us on 08085 007 007 so that we can look into this error for you. We're open from 7am until 10pm seven days a week.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Children's Bonds","content":"Have these Bonds matured? title: How do I cash in my fixed-term Bond?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Yes","content":"Which product are you looking to cash in?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Guaranteed Growth Bonds","content":"Did your Bond last renew before or after 1 May 2019?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Before","content":"If your Bond is maturing shortly, you can provide your options by selecting 'Maturity options' once you have selected your product online. If you are withdrawing your money before your Bond has matured, please select 'Cash in'. You will pay a penalty that is equivalent of 90 days' interest on the amount you cash in.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"After","content":"You can cancel your Bond within 30 days of you receiving your investment record. We'll then refund the full value of your Bond with any interest due.

After the 30 days have passed, you will only be able to cash in your Bond at maturity as it's a fixed-term Bond.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}]},{"title":"Guaranteed Income Bonds","content":"Did your Bond last renew before or after 1 May 2019?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Before","content":"If your Bond is maturing shortly, you can provide your options by selecting 'Maturity options' once you have selected your product online. If you are withdrawing your money before your Bond has matured, please select 'Cash in'. You will pay a penalty that is equivalent to 90 days' interest on the amount you cash in.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"After","content":"You can cancel your Bond within 30 days of you receiving your investment record. We'll then refund the full value of your Bond with any interest due.

After the 30 days have passed, you will only be able to cash in your Bond at maturity as it's a fixed-term Bond.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}]},{"title":"Index-linked Savings Certificate","content":"Did you last renew your certificate before or after 22 June 2023?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Before","content":"You can cash in your Savings Certificates online once you log in - you'll just need your NS&I number and password to hand. 

To do this;

•You'll be asked to enter your NS&I number, surname and password
•Once you've logged in, select to view your Index-linked Savings Certificates account and then click on 'Take money out'
•Enter the amount you want to withdraw and then select 'Cash in'
•Review the details and select 'Confirm'

Please note: if you cash in early online, we'll deduct a penalty from your payment, equivalent to 90 days’ interest on the amount cashed in and, you’ll lose the index-linking on the whole Certificate for the full investment year.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"After","content":"You can cancel your Certificate within 30 days of receiving your investment record. We'll then refund the full value of your Certificate with any interest and index-linking due. After the 30 days have passed, you will only be able to cash in your Certificate when it matures. ","type":"quick","kind":"none","options":[]}]},{"title":"Fixed Interest Savings Certificate","content":"Did you last renew your certificate before or after 22 June 2023?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Before","content":"You can cash in your Savings Certificates online once you log in - you'll just need your NS&I number and password to hand. 

To do this;

•You'll be asked to enter your NS&I number, surname and password
•Once you've logged in, select to view your Fixed Interest Savings Certificates account and then click on 'Take money out'
•Enter the amount you want to withdraw and then select 'Cash in'
•Review the details and select 'Confirm'

Please note: if you cash in early online, we'll deduct a penalty from your payment, equivalent to 90 days’ interest on the amount cashed in.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"After","content":"You can cancel your Certificate within 30 days of receiving your investment record. We'll then refund the full value of your Certificate with any interest due. After the 30 days have passed, you will only be able to cash in your Certificate when it matures. ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}]},{"title":"Children's Bonds","content":" You can cash in your Bonds online once you log in - you'll just need your NS&I number and password to hand. 

To do this;

•You'll be asked to enter your NS&I number, surname and password
•Once you've logged in, select to view your Children's Bonds account and then click on 'Take money out'
•Enter the amount you want to withdraw and then select 'Cash in'
•Review the details and select 'Confirm'

Please note: if you cash in early online, we'll deduct a penalty from your payment, equivalent to 90 days’ interest on the amount cashed in. ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}]},{"title":"No","content":"Which product are you looking to cash in?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Guaranteed Growth Bonds","content":"You can download the postal withdrawal form below.

","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Cash in your Guaranteed Income Bonds","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/files/asset/pdf/guaranteed-income-bonds-cash-in-form-after-20-09-2012.pdf","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"Index-linked Savings Certificate","content":"You can download the postal withdrawal form below.
","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Cash in your Index-linked Savings Certificates","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/files/asset/pdf/index-linked-savings-certificates-cash-in-form-after-20-09-2012.pdf
","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"Fixed Interest Savings Certificates","content":"You can download the postal withdrawal form below.

","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Cash in your Fixed Interest Savings Certificates","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/files/asset/pdf/fixed-interest-savings-certificates-cash-in-form-after-20-09-2012.pdf","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"Children's Bonds","content":"You can complete the online Children's Bonds withdrawal form below.

title: How does NS&I work
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"How NS&I works","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/get-to-know-us/why-nsandi"}],"content":"

When you save with us, what you’re actually doing is lending your money to the government and in return the government gives you interest on your money or, in the case of Premium Bonds, the chance to win cash prizes.

\nBecause we’re part of the government we can guarantee that 100% of your money is safe - we have the unique backing of HM Treasury and that’s something nobody else can offer.Want to find out more about what we do? Check out our blog.","isCTA":true}
phrasings/0: {"text":"How do NS&I invest","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

title: Claim form sent FR6
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"A better way to get your prizes","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/get-to-know-us/quicker-prizes"}],"content":"

If we have sent a claim form when you usually receive cheques, it's likely that a previous cheque has not been cashed.

This may be due to the cheque being lost in the post.

Once you return the form we will pay this prize and then return to posting cheques to you.

 

However, you can avoid all of this by opting to have prizes paid directly into your bank account. Find out more here:

","isCTA":true}

title: Why can't I buy Premium Bonds?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Debit card","content":"When you pay by debit card, your name and address on your card needs to match your address with us. If it doesn’t, the payment won’t be successful.

Or, the headroom - the amount remaining that you can invest - may be temporarily lower than expected if you have money pending in your account. Don’t worry, your headroom will change back within a couple of days so you’ll be able to try again.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Bank transfer","content":"You'll need to use your Premium Bonds holder's number as your reference. You can find this on your Bond record or by logging in to your online account. 

You can check you're using the correct bank details here:

Type of account: Your bank may ask you what type of account you’re paying in to. Please select ‘business’.

Payee name: NS&I

Account number: 11994808

Sort code: 08 31 15

Your money will take up to five working days to reach your account.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}]}],"content":"What payment method are you trying to use to buy Premium Bonds?"}

title: How to certify an authority
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Power of Attorney guide","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/files/asset/pdf/power-of-attorney-leaflet.pdf"}],"content":"

The copy of the Power of Attorney must be certified by one of the following people: The Donor (if they still have capacity); a solicitor; a notary public or, unless it is a Lasting Power of Attorney, a stockbroker. 

The copy of the confirmation of your appointment as Deputy can be certified by any of the following people: A qualified individual who is currently practicing in the legal, financial or teaching profession, doctor or dentist, minister of a recognised religion, civil servant, prison, police or customs officer. 

The certifier must not be related to you by birth or marriage, in a personal relationship with you or live at the same address. 

The certifier must write at the end of each page of the copy: “I certify that this is a true and complete copy of the original [type of document] belonging to [name].” 

Then the certifier must sign and date the copy, print their full name under their signature (affixing any relevant official stamp) and add their occupation, address and daytime phone number. If they have lived at that address for less than three months, they should also give their previous address. Members of professions should also give their institute membership number, if possible. Under anti-money laundering legislation we may verify their identity using this information.For more information on certifying your Authority, please see our Power of Attorney guide:","isCTA":true}
phrasings/0: {"text":"How to certify an authority","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

title: How do I top up savings as a Power of Attorney?
body: {"title":"","options":[{"title":"Yes","content":"If you want to add to an existing account you manage online, simply log in using your details and click on 'Buy more Bonds' or 'Pay money in' for the chosen account or investment on your homepage. You can use a debit card in your own name or in the donor's name. The card must be issued by a UK bank and the address we hold for the cardholder will also need to match the address held by the card issuer.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Log in and invest","content":"https://nsandi.com/login","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"No, I'd like to manage online","content":"If you want to manage the accounts online, you'll need to register for our online and phone service. title: What is the ISA limit for 2021/22 tax year?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Direct ISA","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/products/direct-isa"},{"title":"Junior ISA","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/products/junior-isa"}],"content":"

You can only deposit into one cash ISA in each tax year. The tax year runs from 6 April to 5 April. You can save up to £20,000 in a cash ISA (Direct ISA) and £9,000 in a Junior ISA or split the allowance across other types.

\nYou don't have to make a deposit in every tax year but you wouldn't be able to carry over your allowance into the next tax year. You can find out more by selecting the links below.","isCTA":true}
phrasings/0: {"text":"Do I need to pay money into my ISA in every tax year?","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

You do not need to send a form by post. You can notify us online using the online form below. If you prefer to send a form though and do not have a printer we can post you a form if you call us on 08085 007 007. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.

 

We are unable to send a form via a webchat request.

title: I have further questions about the Green Savings Bonds
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Why has the interest rate decreased for the latest issue of this  bond?","content":"The new interest rates allow us to strike a balance between the needs of our savers, taxpayers and the stability of the broader financial services sector.  ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Where wiil the money go?","content":"Money invested in Green Savings Bonds will be used by HM Treasury to help fund the Government’s chosen green projects, now and in the future. 

The Government has published information regarding the spending on their green projects for 2020-2022 which can be found by searching the term ‘UK Government Green Financing’ following this link
 
","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Where will the money go? ","content":"https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-government-green-financing","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"What are the government’s chosen green projects? ","content":"Money invested into Green Savings Bonds will help to fund the government’s chosen green projects. 
 
These projects fall into these six green spending areas: 
•	Making transport cleaner 
•	Renewable energy over fossil fuels 
•	Preventing pollution 
•	Using energy in a more efficient way 
•	Protecting natural resources 
•	Adapting to a changing climate 
 
You can find more information about how the money invested in Green Savings Bonds is used at nsandi.com 
 
The Government has published information regarding the spending on their green projects for 2020-2022 which can be found by searching the term ‘UK Government Green Financing’ following the link below.
","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"What are the government’s chosen green projects? ","content":"https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-government-green-financing","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"I don’t like some of the Government’s chosen green projects, can I make sure my money isn’t spent on those? ","content":"NS&I won’t have any say on how the money is then spent within those projects – these decisions rest with the Government.  
 
","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Does a green project need to be successful to receive a return on my investment? ","content":"Not at all. You’ll receive a fixed rate of return on your investment. This is guaranteed regardless of the outcome of any of the Government’s chosen green projects. 
 
","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Is the Green Bonds interest rate tax-free?","content":"The interest is taxable but will be paid gross (without tax deducted), in the tax year your Bond matures.

The interest you earn on most savings will count towards your taxable income, but this doesn't mean you'll have to pay tax on it. It all depends on how much interest you earn in total and what rate of tax you pay.
","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Can I cancel the Green Bond if I change my mind?","content":"Yes, don't worry; if you change your mind you can cancel within 30 days of receiving confirmation of your Bond. You can do this online or by contacting us.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Can I buy Green Savings Bonds for my grandchildren?","content":"Sorry, you can't buy Green Savings Bonds for children under 16 but if your looking to save for a child you can find what products we have for young savers by clicking the button below.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Can I withdraw money early from my Green Bonds?","content":"No sorry, you can't withdraw your money until the end of the 3-year term. If you think you might need access to your money you may want to consider a different type of account.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":" Who can buy Green Savings Bonds?","content":"Anyone aged 16 or over can buy Green Savings Bonds; either for yourself, as a joint investment with another person or for another adult if you're acting as their attorney or deputy. Green Savings Bonds can't be held in trust.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}],"content":"What further questions do you have regarding Green Savings Bonds? "}
phrasings/0: {"text":"I have further questions about the Green Savings Bonds","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

title: My account is maturing, what are my options?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Guaranteed Growth Bonds","content":"Your options at maturity are:

•	You can renew for the same term; this will happen automatically unless you choose another option.
•	Renew your Guaranteed Growth Bond for a term of a different length.
•	You can have the full maturity value paid into your nominated bank account.
•	Split your investment by choosing two or more options.

You can change your options at any time up to 3 pm, two working days before the maturity date. You can find the full details of your options in your maturity letter or by logging into your account online by selecting 'Your accounts' and then your maturing account. title: I want to withdraw some money from my account
