Once logged in:

Go to your Premium Bonds account and then select ‘Cash in’. Enter the amount you want to cash in and select ‘Confirm’. 
You'll be shown on-screen when you can expect the payment to reach your account. We will automatically cash in your oldest Bonds first. If you want to cash in specific Bonds, please use this link below and select 'Premium Bonds Cash in form' on the page.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"No","content":"You can now fill out a quick online form to cash in Premium Bonds, without needing to send us any post. Would you like to cash in your own Bonds or your child’s Bonds (under 16)?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Own Bonds","content":"You can cash in your own Premium Bonds online by completing our ‘Premium Bonds cash in form’ at nsandi.com/downloads-and-forms. You can list the specific Bond numbers you're looking to cash in.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Child's Bonds","content":"You can cash in your child's Premium Bonds by completing our ‘Cash in a child's Premium Bonds from’ at nsandi.com/downloads-and-forms. You can list the specific Bond numbers you're looking to cash in.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}]}]},{"title":"Income Bonds","content":"Are you registered to manage your accounts online or by phone?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Yes","content":"You can make a withdrawal from your Income Bonds online by logging into your account - you’ll just need your 11-digit NS&I number and password to hand. You'll be shown on-screen when you can expect the payment to reach your account.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"No","content":"You can download the postal withdrawal form below:","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Income Bonds cash in form","content":"https://forms.nsandi.com/gateway/online-forms/index#/form/withdraw-income-bonds","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}]}]},{"title":"Children's Bonds","content":"Are you registered to manage your accounts online or by phone?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Yes","content":"You can cash in your Bonds online once you log in - you'll just need your NS&I number and password to hand.
To do this:
•You'll be asked to enter your NS&I number, surname and password
•Once you've logged in, select to view your Children's Bonds account and then click on 'Take money out'
•Enter the amount you want to withdraw and then select 'Cash in'
•Review the details and select 'Confirm'

Please note: if you cash in early online, we'll deduct a penalty from your payment, equivalent to 90 days’ interest on the amount cashed in.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"No","content":"You can download the postal withdrawal form below:","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Children's Bonds cash in form","content":"https://forms.nsandi.com/gateway/online-forms/index#/form/withdraw-children-bonds","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]}]},{"title":"Direct ISA","content":"You can make a withdrawal from your Direct ISA online by logging into your account - you’ll just need your 11-digit NS&I number and password to hand.

If you would prefer to transfer the Junior ISA balance to another provider, there's no need to contact us. •Enter the amount you want to withdraw and then select 'Cash in'
•Review the details and select 'Confirm'

title: What is the cooling-off period?
body: {"title":"","options":[{"title":"Premium Bonds","content":"If you change your mind, you can cancel your Premium Bond investment within 14 days of receiving confirmation that the account is open. You can do this online or by phone, or you can write to us and we’ll then refund your payment once the funds have cleared. Debit card payments will take seven banking days to clear.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Income Bonds","content":"If you change your mind, you can cancel your Income Bond investment within 14 days of receiving confirmation that the account is open. You can do this online or by phone, or you can write to us and we’ll then refund your payment once the funds have cleared. Debit card payments will take seven banking days to clear.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Direct Saver","content":"If you change your mind, you can cancel your Direct Saver investment within 14 days of receiving confirmation that the account is open. You can do this online or by phone, or you can write to us and we’ll then refund your payment once the funds have cleared. Debit card payments will take seven banking days to clear.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Direct ISA","content":"If you change your mind, you can cancel your Direct ISA investment within 14 days of receiving confirmation that the account is open. You can do this online or by phone, or you can write to us and we’ll then refund your payment once the funds have cleared. Debit card payments will take seven banking days to clear.\nYou can open another cash ISA within the same tax year if you cancel within the first 14 days.\n","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Junior ISA","content":"If this is your first deposit in the current tax year, you have 14 days to change your mind. You can do this online or by phone, or you can write to us. You can open another cash Junior ISA if you cancel within the first 14 days. This is the only opportunity to cancel, as there is no right to change your mind after this.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Guaranteed Growth Bonds","content":"If your investment has recently matured, you can cancel within 30 days of receiving confirmation of your renewed Bond and we’ll repay in full. Once this time has passed you will need to wait until the end of the term to make a withdrawal. You can do this online or by phone, or you can write to us.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Guaranteed Income Bonds","content":"If your investment has recently matured, you can cancel within 30 days of receiving confirmation of your renewed Bond and we’ll repay in full. Once this time has passed you will need to wait until the end of the term to make a withdrawal. You can do this online or by phone, or you can write to us.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Green Savings Bonds","content":"If you change your mind, you can cancel within 30 days of receiving confirmation of your Bond. After the cooling-off period has passed, you’ll need to keep the Bond in for the full term.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Index Linked Savings Certificates","content":"If you change your mind, you can cancel within 30 days of receiving confirmation of your new matured Saving Certificate and we'll repay the amount in full. You can still cash it in before the end of the term but we will deduct a penalty equal to 90 days of interest and you’ll not earn any index-linked growth for the investment year in which you cash in.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Fixed Interest Savings Certifcates","content":"If you change your mind, you can cancel within 30 days of receiving confirmation of your new matured Saving Certificate and we'll repay the amount in full. You can still cash it in before the end of the term but we will deduct a penalty equal to 90 days of interest.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}],"content":"The cooling off period is the number of days you have to cancel your investment after you’ve opened an account, made a deposit, or if it’s passed the maturity date. The length of time to cancel will differ per account you hold with us. Which account is this for?"}

title: Registered PB cash in instructions
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Log in","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/login"},{"title":"Cash in specific Bonds","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/downloads-and-forms"}],"content":"

You can make a withdrawal from your or your child's Premium Bonds online by logging into your account - you’ll just need your 11-digit NS&I number and password to hand.

Once logged in;

• Go to your Premium Bonds account and then select ‘Cash in’. Enter the amount you want to cash in and select ‘Confirm’. 

 

You'll be shown on-screen when you can expect the payment to reach your account.

We will automatically cash in your oldest Bonds first. If you want to cash in specific Bonds, please use this link below and select 'Premium Bonds Cash in form' on the page. ","isCTA":true}
phrasings/0: {"text":"Registered PB cash in instructions","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

title: What happens when an account holder turns 16?
body: {"title":"","options":[{"title":"Registration form","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/files/asset/pdf/online-and-phone-service-registration-form.pdf"}],"content":"As soon as you turn 16, you become responsible for your own NS&I account(s). The easiest way to manage them is to use our online service.<page_separator delay=\"3\"/>You’ll need to complete a registration form and send it to us first. This is because we need someone to witness your signature as proof of identity. A witness can be anyone over the age of 18, but who is not a family member. <page_separator delay=\"5\"/>Once we have this, you’ll be able to manage your accounts online (except for Investment Account, which can only be managed by post). You can print a registration form using the link below.","isCTA":true}
phrasings/0: {"text":"What happens when an account holder turns 16?","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

title: I've not received my prize for this month
body: {"title":"","options":[{"title":"Through the post","content":"With millions of prizes to send every month, it can take us a while to get around to everyone.\n\nIf you still haven’t received your winnings by the end of the month, please call us on 08085 007 007 to let us know so that we can deal with this. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Automatic reinvestment","content":"If you have your prizes automatically reinvested and you can’t see the money after the third working day of the month, please call us on 08085 007 007 for us to look into this. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Straight into your nominated account","content":"If you have your prizes paid straight to your nominated account and you can’t see the money after the seventh working day of the month, please call us on 08085 007 007 to make sure we’ve got the right details for you. We're open from 8am until 8pm Monday to Friday and 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}],"content":"How are you set up to receive your prizes?"}
phrasings/0: {"text":"I've not received my prize for this month","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

title: I have an Investment Account
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Our products","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/products"}],"content":"Our Investment Account is a postal-only account that can’t be managed online, so we have decided to no longer promote it on our website.

Additionally, it pays our lowest rate of interest so we’re not encouraging customers to apply for nor invest further into this account. All our other accounts pay higher rates.

\n

We do offer a switching service that will enable you to switch the Investment Account to an account that can be managed more efficiently online.

\nIf you'd like to switch accounts, head over to our products page for more information about how our accounts work, the latest interest rates and how to switch over:","isCTA":true}
phrasings/0: {"text":"I have an Investment Account","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

We do offer a switching service that will enable you to switch the Investment Account to an account that can be managed more efficiently online.

\nIf you'd like to switch accounts, head over to our products page for more information about how our accounts work, the latest interest rates and how to switch over:","isCTA":true}

","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}],"content":"Do we hold an up to date phone number for you?"}

title: Why have I not earned any interest on my statement?
body: {"title":"","options":[{"title":"Guaranteed Growth Bonds","content":"Did your Bond last renew before or after 1st May 2019?","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"After","content":"Don’t worry, if your Bond matured after the 1st May 2019 your interest will be added at the end of the full term, so this won’t show on your April statement.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Before","content":"Don’t worry, if your Bond matured before the 1st May 2019 your interest will be added on your anniversary date of when you made your initial investment, so this won’t show on your April statement.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}]},{"title":"Green Savings Bonds","content":"Don’t worry, we add interest to the Bond on each anniversary of the date you bought it. So, if your Bond hasn’t completed its first full year yet this will show as zero on your April statement.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]},{"title":"Fixed Savings Certificates","content":"Don’t worry, we add interest to your certificates on each anniversary of the date you bought it. So, if your Fixed Interest Saving Certificates haven’t completed their first full year yet this will show as zero on your April statement.","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[]}],"content":"I can help you with that, what investment is this for?"}
phrasings/0: {"text":"Why have I not earned any interest on my statement?","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

title: How do I change my Premium Bonds prize options?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Yes","content":"You can update your prize options online by logging into your account - you'll just need your 11-digit NS&I number and your password to hand. Once logged in:
                              
• Go to 'Your accounts' in the top menu and select 'Premium Bonds'
• Then click 'Change details' under your holding details.
• You can either set your bank account or you're NS&I Direct Saver if you have one, as your nominated account to receive your prizes.
","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Log in","content":"https://nsandi.com/login","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"No","content":"If you're not registered for our online and phone service, you can change your prize options by clicking the link below. You'll just need your holder's number, bank account details and sort code to hand. ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Change prize options","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/prize-options","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]}],"content":"Are you registered to manage your savings online and by phone?"}

{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Yes","content":"You can update your prize options online by logging into your account - you'll just need your 11-digit NS&I number and your password to hand. Once logged in:
                              
• Go to 'Your accounts' in the top menu and select 'Premium Bonds'
• Then click 'Change details' under your holding details.
• You can either set your bank account or you're NS&I Direct Saver if you have one, as your nominated account to receive your prizes.
","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Log in","content":"https://nsandi.com/login","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]},{"title":"No","content":"If you're not registered for our online and phone service, you can change your prize options by clicking the link below. You'll just need your holder's number, bank account details and sort code to hand. ","type":"persist","kind":"none","options":[{"title":"Change prize options","content":"https://www.nsandi.com/prize-options","type":"persist","kind":"url","options":[]}]}],"content":"Are you registered to manage your savings online and by phone?"}
phrasings/0: {"text":"I want my prizes paid straight into my bank account","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

title: I can't upload my documents online
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"How to clear your cache","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/378476/how-to-clear-your-cache.pdf"}],"content":"

If you're having trouble uploading your documents online, please check:

- Upload is a JPEG or TIFF file no larger than 2MB

- Upload is clear and details match those on your application 

- Document used for proof of your identity and address are different

If you are still having problems, please attempt to clear your browser cache or try this on another browser.

Clearing your cache helps to troubleshoot, make the loading time of web pages quicker and increases the performance of your computer/device. You can find instructions on how to clear your cache by clicking on the link below","isCTA":true}

title: I can't upload my documents online
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"How to clear your cache","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/378476/how-to-clear-your-cache.pdf"}],"content":"

If you're having trouble uploading your documents online, please check:

- Upload is a JPEG or TIFF file no larger than 2MB

- Upload is clear and details match those on your application 

- Document used for proof of your identity and address are different

If you are still having problems, please attempt to clear your browser cache or try this on another browser.

Clearing your cache helps to troubleshoot, make the loading time of web pages quicker and increases the performance of your computer/device. You can find instructions on how to clear your cache by clicking on the link below","isCTA":true}

title: My relative has passed, how can I claim their savings?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Claim a customer's savings after a bereavement","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/manage-money-for-others/customers-who-have-died"}],"content":"

Sorry to hear of your sad loss. Our dedicated team can help you with this.

\nBefore you can cash in or close the account, you will just need to get the executor, legal representative or next of kin to fill out an online form which can be found by clicking on the button below.Don’t worry if you don’t have many/any details of the account, just give us as much information as you can and we’ll write back to you.","isCTA":true}

\nBefore you can cash in or close the account, you will just need to get the executor, legal representative or next of kin to fill out an online form which can be found by clicking on the button below.Don’t worry if you don’t have many/any details of the account, just give us as much information as you can and we’ll write back to you.","isCTA":true}
phrasings/0: {"text":"Reinvest Premium Bonds of someone who has died","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

title: I want to learn everything about Guaranteed Growth Bonds and Guaranteed Income Bonds
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"What will happen at the end of the term? ","kind":"articleTitle","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"2069068812|What will happen at the end of the term? "},{"title":"Is there a cooling off period?","kind":"articleTitle","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"2069069232|Is there a cooling-off period if I change my mind?"},{"title":"Can I access the money in an emergency? ","kind":"articleTitle","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"2069069472|What if I need access to my money in an emergency?"},{"title":"Do you pay tax on Guaranteed Bonds? ","kind":"articleTitle","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"1755806642|Do you pay tax on your Growth Bonds when they mature?"}],"content":"

Guaranteed Growth Bonds and Guaranteed Income Bonds are no longer on sale. It is not possible to apply for a new bond or to add more money to an existing bond. You can view the range of investments we have available on our website by clicking here.

 

Do you have any questions about existing bonds?

 

 

","isCTA":true}

title: Can I transfer my other NS&I account to Green Savings Bonds?
body: {"title":"","options":[{"title":"Switching from an NS&I account","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/manage-your-savings/switching"}],"content":"Yes, you can transfer from an existing investment with NS&I to open a Green Savings Bond by completing a switching form. You can find the details of how to do this by selecting the 'Switching from an NS&I account' link below.<page_separator delay=\"5\"/>If you've invested in a Guaranteed Growth Bond or Guaranteed Income Bond after 1 May 2021 you won't be able to switch from these accounts until 30 days before your Bond matures.<page_separator delay=\"5\"/>If you have an Index Linked Savings Certificate or Fixed Interest Savings Certificate, a penalty may apply if you decide to switch. In any case, please see your customer agreement for more details.","isCTA":true}

title: Two-factor authentication help
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Two factor authentication help","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/two-factor-authentication-help"}],"content":"

If you're being sent back to the log in page at any stage during the authentication process, please allow at least ten seconds before you attempt to login again.

If this does not resolve your issue, please try switching or updating your browser.

If you are using a Samsung mobile please only use Chrome, Edge or Mozilla Firefox rather than the Samsung browser, which isn't supported; if you are using an iPad or iPhone please use Safari instead.

The supported browsers you can use are:

  • Safari version 11 or later for macOS and iOS 
  • Google Chrome version 60 or later on Windows, Android, macOS and iOS
  • Microsoft Edge version 79 or later for Windows and macOS 
  • Mozilla Firefox version 56 or later for Windows and macOS (Firefox for Mobile is not supported)
  • Opera version 60.3 or later for Windows and macOS (Opera Touch is not supported)
Also, please make sure that your date and time are accurate on the device you're using and that you are not using private browsing (incognito mode). You can find a list of all our supported browsers and further information by clicking on the link below.","isCTA":true}
phrasings/0: {"text":"I'm caught in a loop","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

title: Two-factor authentication help
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Two factor authentication help","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/two-factor-authentication-help"}],"content":"

If you're being sent back to the log in page at any stage during the authentication process, please allow at least ten seconds before you attempt to login again.

If this does not resolve your issue, please try switching or updating your browser.

If you are using a Samsung mobile please only use Chrome, Edge or Mozilla Firefox rather than the Samsung browser, which isn't supported; if you are using an iPad or iPhone please use Safari instead.

The supported browsers you can use are:

  • Safari version 11 or later for macOS and iOS 
  • Google Chrome version 60 or later on Windows, Android, macOS and iOS
  • Microsoft Edge version 79 or later for Windows and macOS 
  • Mozilla Firefox version 56 or later for Windows and macOS (Firefox for Mobile is not supported)
  • Opera version 60.3 or later for Windows and macOS (Opera Touch is not supported)
Also, please make sure that your date and time are accurate on the device you're using and that you are not using private browsing (incognito mode). You can find a list of all our supported browsers and further information by clicking on the link below.","isCTA":true}

title: How can I invest more than £100K
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Guaranteed Income Bonds Application","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/files/asset/pdf/guaranteed-income-bonds-application-form.pdf"},{"title":"Guaranteed Growth Bonds Application","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/files/asset/pdf/guaranteed-growth-bonds-application-form.pdf"}],"content":"

To invest more than £99,999 in a single bond you will need to send a form with a cheque. You can send the form by standard post or by any courier mail service requiring a signature on delivery.  You can download a form below or if you do not have a printer please call us on 08085 007 007 and we will be happy to post one to you.

If the forms do not show below click the 'x' to show less in the top right of the white box.

 

 

","isCTA":true}

title: Why have I been asked to send a Grant of Probate?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Gov.uk","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.gov.uk/applying-for-probate"}],"content":"

A Grant of Probate, Grant of Representation or Confirmation are different terms for the documents issued to give someone the legal right to deal with the savings, property and other assets of a person who has died.

 

We may ask for this if the customer's total NS&I savings are £5,000 or over. The Director of Savings also reserves the right to request a Grant of Representation for savings of any value.

 

If we ask you to send this document to us it is the case that we will need to verify it.

 

For advice on obtaing Probate you can visit the .gov website or call the number below.

 

0333 123 1072


The Probate and Inheritance Tax Helpline is open Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm.

 

 

 

","isCTA":true}
phrasings/0: {"text":"Why have I been asked to send a Grant of Probate?","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

title: Can I merge my accounts?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Merging your NS&I accounts","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/manage-your-savings/merging-your-accounts"}],"content":"

To merge your account(s), please write to us at NS&I, Sunderland SR43 2SB with a signed letter. Please include your name, date of birth, your home address and your NS&I number that you log in with. If your name or address has changed, please also include your previous details.

If you can, please share details of the accounts or investments you’d like to merge such as your holder and account numbers. For more information on what to include visit our help page.

 

 

 

 

 

","isCTA":true}

title: What is Pay by bank account?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Pay by bank account","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/ways-to-pay/pay-bank-account"}],"content":"

Pay by bank account is a new safe and easy way to deposit in to your NS&I investment.

It means you can make deposits through our website without needing to enter your debit card details or a reference number. It's highly secure as you will approve each payment through your bank’s own app or website.

In most cases the money will leave your bank account straight away, then it can take up to two hours to reach your NS&I account. It can sometimes take longer to leave your account, for example if your bank needs to make extra checks.

 

You can read how the service works and view a step by step guide by clicking the link below.","isCTA":true}
phrasings/0: {"text":"What is Pay by bank account? ","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

title: I think fraud has been committed on my account?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Our online security promise","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/get-to-know-us/security/our-online-security-promise"},{"title":"Contact us","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/contact-us"}],"content":"

Please contact us immediately on 08085 007 007 giving us as much detail as possible if:

 

  • you think you’ve responded to a fraudulent email
  • someone may have seen your security details
  • you believe someone else has accessed your accounts
  • you have any other fraudulent suspicions
","isCTA":true}

title: I'm still having problems.
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Contact us","kind":"articleTitle","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"1621576152|How can I contact you?"}],"content":"I'm sorry to hear this, if you've updated your browser and you're still having problems, there are a few things that you can try to resolve the issue.
  • Check that your update or installation hasn't failed (you can download again if needed)

 

  • Set your newly-installed browser as your default browser
  • Check that you have a good and stable internet connection

 

  • Check for any problems with your device settings or storage.
  • If you are using a shared network such as a virtual private network (VPN) public WiFI or workplace network check your local internet security settings.

 

  • We don’t support Samsung Internet, Internet Explorer, Amazon Silk, or Facebook mobile so make sure you're using our supported browsers.
Don't worry, if you need more support you can speak to one of our teams so that we can help you further.","isCTA":true}
phrasings/0: {"text":"I'm still having problems.","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

  • Check that your update or installation hasn't failed (you can download again if needed)

 

  • Set your newly-installed browser as your default browser
  • Check that you have a good and stable internet connection

 

  • Check for any problems with your device settings or storage.
  • If you are using a shared network such as a virtual private network (VPN) public WiFI or workplace network check your local internet security settings.

 

  • We don’t support Samsung Internet, Internet Explorer, Amazon Silk, or Facebook mobile so make sure you're using our supported browsers.
Don't worry, if you need more support you can speak to one of our teams so that we can help you further.","isCTA":true}
phrasings/0: {"text":"already done still not working","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

title: I'm still having problems.
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Contact us","kind":"articleTitle","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"1621576152|How can I contact you?"}],"content":"I'm sorry to hear this, if you've updated your browser and you're still having problems, there are a few things that you can try to resolve the issue.
  • Check that your update or installation hasn't failed (you can download again if needed)

 

  • Set your newly-installed browser as your default browser
  • Check that you have a good and stable internet connection

 

  • Check for any problems with your device settings or storage.
  • If you are using a shared network such as a virtual private network (VPN) public WiFI or workplace network check your local internet security settings.

 

  • We don’t support Samsung Internet, Internet Explorer, Amazon Silk, or Facebook mobile so make sure you're using our supported browsers.
Don't worry, if you need more support you can speak to one of our teams so that we can help you further.","isCTA":true}
phrasings/0: {"text":"I have done that and it's still not working","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

title: How do I change my PIN?
body: {"title":"","options":[{"title":"Log in","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/login"}],"content":"If you've forgotten your PIN or you simply want to change it then all you need to is log into your account online at nsandi.com, just go to 'Your profile' and click on 'Your details' and scroll down to 'Pin'<page_separator delay=\"5\"/>The PIN has six digits, and these cannot run in sequence. So, you can't use 111, 222 or 123. Your PIN must be difficult for others to guess and should not include birthdays or other memorable dates.","isCTA":true}

title: How does two-factor authentication work?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Improved security","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/get-to-know-us/security/improved-security"}],"content":"This is an additional security measure that helps prevent fraud. You may already be familiar with this kind of security from other websites or when banking online.So that you can continue to have a seamless experience when logging in to your NS&I account, we need to have your up-to-date phone number.  A mobile phone is best, so you'll be able to receive a one-time passcode by text message (or automated phone call) at least once when you log in.

The first time you log in, we'll also ask you to create a 6-digit PIN as an extra piece of security. But don't worry, you'll only need to do this each time you log in from a different device. You can find more information about our improved security by clicking on the link below:

\n","isCTA":true}
phrasings/0: {"text":"Why am I being asked to set up a pin?","autoComplete":true,"negativeSample":false,"entitiesMeta":[]}

title: How do I transfer Bonds from someone who has passed away?
body: {"title":"","options":[{"title":"Claim a customer's savings after a bereavement","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/manage-money-for-others/customers-who-have-died"}],"content":"Sorry to hear of your sad loss. If a Premium Bonds holder dies, their Bonds can't be transferred to another person and would need to be cashed in.<page_separator delay=\"5\"/>But their Bonds can remain in the prize draw for a further 12 months following their date of death. All you need to do for now is get the executor, legal representative or next of kin to fill out a form online which can be found by clicking on the button below.","isCTA":true}

title: Is there a limit to how much I can withdraw?
body:
{"title":"","options":[{"title":"Repayment calculator","kind":"url","type":"persist","events":[],"content":"https://www.nsandi.com/help/manage-your-savings/make-withdrawal-from-savings"}],"content":"

There is no upper limit to the amount you can withdraw from our investments. Depending on the amount you want to withdraw the timescales of the repayment could change.You can find out how long it takes to receive your payment using our online repayment calculator.

\nIf you have a fixed term investment you may not be allowed to withdraw the money until the investment next matures.You can read more about this following the link below.","isCTA":true}

title: Premium Bond Prize Fund Rate
body:
